intro: Myosurus minimus var. apus, commonly known as the lesser mouse-ear, is a small, mat-forming plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its dense clusters of tiny, rounded leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Myosurus minimus var. apus is a rare and delicate species, often requiring specific environmental conditions to flourish.
